result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel L Sly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
07-06-2016/ William S Pocan
The Court ordered the defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $756.00, to be paid to Pamela U., and to be paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Correction,  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Hearing July 6, 2016.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Huber privileges for work, no more than 45 hours per week, and school.

07-07-2016 Correction to payment order:
Costs and surcharges are to we paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Correction.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
**
Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% of prison wages.   Any balance as a conditiion of ES.  If not paid within one year, a civil judgment to be entered.

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet
reflects 07-06-16 Court order for restitution and correction to payment order for costs & surcharges
For the Sentencing hearing.  Costs and surcharges are due within one year of leaving the House of Correction.  If not paid, Civil judgment be entered.

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Defendant Daniel L Sly in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Restitution hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Pamela U.   Arguments heard.  Restitution is ordered in the amount of $756.00 to be paid to Pamela U., collected by DOC out of up to 25% of any applicable prison funds and wages.   To be paid within 1 year of leaving the House of Correction.  If not paid, a civil judgment be entered.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.

Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
As to amended count 1: 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 8  months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 5 
days time served, Huber privileges for work no more than 45 hours per week, and school.  
  
- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid within one year, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.  Court order 20 days to appeal.    
- Received and filed:   
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Letters from defense  Restitution hearing scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Letter on behalf of the defendant, received and filed.

AS TO THE AMENDED COUNT 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.   DNA notification given.  Any issues of restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior for Michael Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.
MOTION TO COMPLEL DISCOVERY AND INSPECTION.  FILED BY MARK A. PECORA, ESQ. HARTLEY PECORA LAW OFFICE. kl

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests jury trial.    Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  Filed, signed Felony  Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Sanders.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.

Deputy clerk contacted Br. 26 regarding next court date.

Case adjourned for scheduling in Branch 26.  Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with Attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for final pre-trial on today's date.
Defense counsel files Request For Substitution Of Judge.

Atty. Pecora's assistant telephoned the court to request brief adjournment as Atty. Pecora is unable to appear in court on 12-14-2015.  Case rescheduled for final pre-trial on 12-16-2015 at 8:30 a.m.  Atty. Pecora will notify his client.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial conducted.   Defense conducting additional investigation.  Defense just requested police squad video.  Defense motion for adjournment of trial heard and granted.  Matter calendared for final pretrial and jury trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Matter rescheduled for a final pretrial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
The state needs additional time to turn over discovery materials; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel L Sly in court with attorney Mark A Pecora.  Ronald Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.
